timeline.message: change spring-data-gremlin to current version in springboot
change version tag for spring-data-gremlin from current to dependency
try to suppress attach-javadoc warnings for now

timeline.bodyText: This should be current in the tag, not dependency version
timeline.author: JimSuplizio
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,193 @@
+# Azure Spring Data Gremlin client library for Java
+
+## Key concepts
+
+**Spring Data Gremlin** provides initial Spring Data support for those databases using Gremlin query language. With annotation oriented programming model, it simplified the mapping to the database entity. It also provides supports for basic and custom query. 
+
+This project works with *any Gremlin-compatible* data store, and also with [Azure Cosmos DB](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/cosmos-db/introduction). Cosmos is a globally-distributed database service that allows developers to work with data using a variety of standard APIs, such as Graph, MongoDB, and SQL. Spring Data Gremlin provides a delightful experience to interact with Azure Cosmos DB Graph API. 
+
+### Feature List
+- Spring Data CRUDRepository basic CRUD functionality
+    - save
+    - findAll
+    - findById
+    - deleteAll
+    - deleteById
+- Spring Data [@Id](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-commons/blob/master/src/main/java/org/springframework/data/annotation/Id.java) annotation.
+  There're 2 ways to map a field in domain class to `id` field of a database entity.
+  - annotate a field in domain class with `@Id` 
+  - set name of this field to `id`
+- Default annotation
+  - `@Vertex` maps an `Object` to a `Vertex`
+  - `@VertexSet` maps a set of `Vertex`
+  - `@Edge` maps an `Object` to an `Edge`
+  - `@EdgeSet` maps to a set of `Edge`
+  - `@EdgeFrom` maps to the head `Vertex` of an `Edge`
+  - `@EdgeTo` maps to the tail `Vertex` of an `Edge`
+  - `@Graph` maps to an `Object` to a `Graph`
+- Supports advanced operations 
+  - `<T> T findVertexById(Object id, Class<T> domainClass);`
+  - `<T> T findEdgeById(Object id, Class<T> domainClass);`
+  - `<T> boolean isEmptyGraph(T object)`
+  - `long vertexCount()`
+  - `long edgeCount()`
+- Supports [Spring Data custom query](https://docs.spring.io/spring-data/commons/docs/current/reference/html/#repositories.query-methods.details) find operation, e.g.,  `findByAFieldAndBField`
+- Supports any class type in domain class including collection and nested type.
+
+
+### Spring Data Version Support
+This repository only supports Spring Data 2.x. Version mapping between spring boot and spring-data-gremlin: 
+
+| Spring boot version                                         | spring-data-gremlin version                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
+|:-----------------------------------------------------------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------:|
+| ![version](https://img.shields.io/badge/version-2.3.x-blue) | [![Maven Central](https://img.shields.io/maven-central/v/com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin/spring-data-gremlin/2.3.svg)](https://search.maven.org/search?q=g:com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin%20AND%20a:spring-data-gremlin%20AND%20v:2.3.*) |
+| ![version](https://img.shields.io/badge/version-2.2.x-blue) | [![Maven Central](https://img.shields.io/maven-central/v/com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin/spring-data-gremlin/2.2.svg)](https://search.maven.org/search?q=g:com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin%20AND%20a:spring-data-gremlin%20AND%20v:2.2.*) |
+| ![version](https://img.shields.io/badge/version-2.1.x-blue) | [![Maven Central](https://img.shields.io/maven-central/v/com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin/spring-data-gremlin/2.1.svg)](https://search.maven.org/search?q=g:com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin%20AND%20a:spring-data-gremlin%20AND%20v:2.1.*) |
+| ![version](https://img.shields.io/badge/version-2.0.x-blue) | [![Maven Central](https://img.shields.io/maven-central/v/com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin/spring-data-gremlin/2.0.svg)](https://search.maven.org/search?q=g:com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin%20AND%20a:spring-data-gremlin%20AND%20v:2.0.*) |
+
+## Getting started
+
+### Add the dependency
+`spring-data-gremlin` is published on Maven Central Repository.  
+If you are using Maven, add the following dependency.  
+
+[//]: # ({x-version-update-start;com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin:spring-data-gremlin;dependency})

replies.bodyText: Got it, will make the change.

+    <version>1.0.0</version>
+    <relativePath>../pom.xml</relativePath>
+  </parent>
+
+  <artifactId>azure-spring-data-sample-gremlin-web-service</artifactId>
+  <name>Spring Data gremlin - Web Service</name>
+
+  <dependencies>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
+      <artifactId>spring-boot</artifactId>
+    </dependency>
+

+    </dependency>

+    </dependency>
+

+      <artifactId>json-path</artifactId>
+    </dependency>
+
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin</groupId>
+      <artifactId>spring-data-gremlin</artifactId>
+      <version>2.3.1-beta.1</version>

replies.bodyText: Does the update-version script take care of this scenario now?
replies.author: saragluna

replies.bodyText: @saragluna the update script isn't the problem, it's the verification scripts. If this isn't tagged and dependencies are updated it'll get skipped.
replies.author: JimSuplizio

replies.bodyText: Updated. So will the verification scripts scan these dependencies defined in spring samples too? Given that they're not parenting off the sdk-client-parent pom, but using spring-boot-parent.
replies.author: saragluna

replies.bodyText: @saragluna no. The update_versions script will still update the tag, it's the scanner script that doesn't verify because of the parentage. This has allowed several tags that were either incorrect or had incorrect versions to get checked in.
replies.author: JimSuplizio

timeline.bodyText: Same comment as sdk/spring/azure-spring-boot-samples/azure-spring-data-sample-gremlin-web-service/pom.xml concerning the update tag.

+  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>
+
+  <parent>
+    <groupId>com.microsoft.azure</groupId>
+    <artifactId>azure-spring-boot-samples</artifactId>
+    <version>1.0.0</version>
+    <relativePath>../pom.xml</relativePath>
+  </parent>
+
+  <artifactId>azure-spring-data-sample-gremlin</artifactId>
+  <name>Spring Data gremlin - Sample</name>
+
+  <dependencies>
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
+      <artifactId>spring-boot</artifactId>
+    </dependency>
+
+    <dependency>

+    </dependency>
+
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>org.springframework.boot</groupId>
+      <artifactId>spring-boot-starter-data-rest</artifactId>
+    </dependency>
+
+    <dependency>
+      <groupId>com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin</groupId>
+      <artifactId>spring-data-gremlin</artifactId>
+      <version>2.3.1-beta.1</version>

timeline.bodyText: nit: The Cosmosdb comment should be above the cosmosdb dependency

replies.bodyText: Cosmos DB also supports the Gremlin API and that's why we put these two together.
replies.author: saragluna

timeline.bodyText:
This is a good time to rename this library. The previous dependency was an external_dependency but with this PR all of those external dependency references are going away and the only reference is the current version. Renaming the groupId to com.azure and the artifactId to azure-spring-data-gremlin will also allow to remove the bannedDependency Includes for com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin from sdk/spring/azure-spring-boot/pom.xml and sdk/spring/azure-spring-boot-starter-data-gremlin/pom.xml as they'll now be under the com.azure:* blanket include.
The dependency version here is one that has been released from a different repository, and all references to the external_dependency has been removed, since this is effectively a brand new library in the repository both the current and dependency version should be 2.3.1-beta.1. If, in the future, 2.3.0 is needed by something then it would be an external dependency.
timeline.author: JimSuplizio

replies.bodyText: @jialindai is it okay we do the renaming now in this PR?
replies.author: saragluna

@@ -0,0 +1,193 @@
+# Azure Spring Data Gremlin client library for Java
+
+## Key concepts
+
+**Spring Data Gremlin** provides initial Spring Data support for those databases using Gremlin query language. With annotation oriented programming model, it simplified the mapping to the database entity. It also provides supports for basic and custom query. 
+
+This project works with *any Gremlin-compatible* data store, and also with [Azure Cosmos DB](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/cosmos-db/introduction). Cosmos is a globally-distributed database service that allows developers to work with data using a variety of standard APIs, such as Graph, MongoDB, and SQL. Spring Data Gremlin provides a delightful experience to interact with Azure Cosmos DB Graph API. 
+
+### Feature List
+- Spring Data CRUDRepository basic CRUD functionality
+    - save
+    - findAll
+    - findById
+    - deleteAll
+    - deleteById
+- Spring Data [@Id](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-data-commons/blob/master/src/main/java/org/springframework/data/annotation/Id.java) annotation.
+  There're 2 ways to map a field in domain class to `id` field of a database entity.
+  - annotate a field in domain class with `@Id` 
+  - set name of this field to `id`
+- Default annotation
+  - `@Vertex` maps an `Object` to a `Vertex`
+  - `@VertexSet` maps a set of `Vertex`
+  - `@Edge` maps an `Object` to an `Edge`
+  - `@EdgeSet` maps to a set of `Edge`
+  - `@EdgeFrom` maps to the head `Vertex` of an `Edge`
+  - `@EdgeTo` maps to the tail `Vertex` of an `Edge`
+  - `@Graph` maps to an `Object` to a `Graph`
+- Supports advanced operations 
+  - `<T> T findVertexById(Object id, Class<T> domainClass);`
+  - `<T> T findEdgeById(Object id, Class<T> domainClass);`
+  - `<T> boolean isEmptyGraph(T object)`
+  - `long vertexCount()`
+  - `long edgeCount()`
+- Supports [Spring Data custom query](https://docs.spring.io/spring-data/commons/docs/current/reference/html/#repositories.query-methods.details) find operation, e.g.,  `findByAFieldAndBField`
+- Supports any class type in domain class including collection and nested type.
+
+
+### Spring Data Version Support
+This repository only supports Spring Data 2.x. Version mapping between spring boot and spring-data-gremlin: 
+
+| Spring boot version                                         | spring-data-gremlin version                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |
+|:-----------------------------------------------------------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------:|
+| ![version](https://img.shields.io/badge/version-2.3.x-blue) | [![Maven Central](https://img.shields.io/maven-central/v/com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin/spring-data-gremlin/2.3.svg)](https://search.maven.org/search?q=g:com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin%20AND%20a:spring-data-gremlin%20AND%20v:2.3.*) |
+| ![version](https://img.shields.io/badge/version-2.2.x-blue) | [![Maven Central](https://img.shields.io/maven-central/v/com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin/spring-data-gremlin/2.2.svg)](https://search.maven.org/search?q=g:com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin%20AND%20a:spring-data-gremlin%20AND%20v:2.2.*) |
+| ![version](https://img.shields.io/badge/version-2.1.x-blue) | [![Maven Central](https://img.shields.io/maven-central/v/com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin/spring-data-gremlin/2.1.svg)](https://search.maven.org/search?q=g:com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin%20AND%20a:spring-data-gremlin%20AND%20v:2.1.*) |
+| ![version](https://img.shields.io/badge/version-2.0.x-blue) | [![Maven Central](https://img.shields.io/maven-central/v/com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin/spring-data-gremlin/2.0.svg)](https://search.maven.org/search?q=g:com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin%20AND%20a:spring-data-gremlin%20AND%20v:2.0.*) |
+
+## Getting started
+
+### Add the dependency
+`spring-data-gremlin` is published on Maven Central Repository.  
+If you are using Maven, add the following dependency.  
+
+[//]: # ({x-version-update-start;com.microsoft.spring.data.gremlin:spring-data-gremlin;current})

replies.bodyText: Thanks for pointing it out, will update it.
replies.author: saragluna

timeline.bodyText: This artifact name looks odd to me. Is azure-spring-boot different from azure-spring-data? I'm asking because above you have azure-spring-boot-sample-data-gremlin and here we have azure-spring-data-sample-gremlin, shouldn't this be ending with sample-data-gremlin?
timeline.author: JimSuplizio
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -82,3 +85,7 @@ extends:
         groupId: com.azure
       - name: azure-spring-boot-sample-storage-blob
         groupId: com.azure
+      - name: azure-spring-data-sample-gremlin

replies.bodyText: Yes, azure-spring-boot is different from azure-spring-data.  Spring Boot and Spring Data are different projects in Spring and azure-spring-boot is the azure implementation for Spring Boot, the same case for azure-spring-data.
replies.author: saragluna

replies.bodyText: And the azure-spring-boot-sample-data-gremlin is a sample demonstrating how to use azure-spring-boot-starter for azure-spring-data-gremlin.
replies.author: saragluna

timeline.message: correct azure-spring-data-gremlin artifact id / group id in README file
